alert.note: Alert for San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 1:55AM PST until December 24 at 4:15AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A disorganized band of shower activity is moving into the region with periods of moderate rain. Soils are already saturated and there are reports of roadway flooding in the past hour, especially in areas of poor drainage. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by periods of moderate rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Bay Area, including the following counties, San Francisco, San Mateo, and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 330 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 141 AM PST, Local law enforcement has reported flooding in some roadways due to recent rain activity in the advisory area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Soils are already saturated as 1 to 4 inches have already fallen across the Bay Area in the past several days. - Additional rainfall amounts of a tenth up to a quarter inch are expected over the area in the next couple of hours as this disorganized band moves inland. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, especially in poor drainage areas. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding include... San Francisco, Daly City, San Mateo, Redwood City, Palo Alto, South San Francisco, Santa Cruz, San Bruno, Pacifica, Menlo Park, Foster City, Burlingame, San Carlos, Belmont, Millbrae, Corralitos, Scotts Valley, Half Moon Bay, Hillsborough and Capitola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: It is very difficult to see road conditions at night so be extra cautious. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
